title: NI 100: Tracing the history of the 100-year-old Irish border
description: On May 3 1921 Northern Ireland came into being as the partition of Ireland took legal effect.

title: Huawei Mate X2: Mastering the folding phone formula
description: Huawei has revealed the third iteration of its folding phone, taking inspiration from Samsung.

title: Apetamin: Instagram criticised over weight gain drug
description: NHS England calls for a clamp down on the targeting of the "dangerous" unlicensed drug at young women.

title: Carbon: How calls for climate justice are shaking the world
description: Young activists are breathing new life into the long-running debate over how to cut carbon fairly.

title: 'I was terrible at crosswords so I built an AI to do them'
description: Dr Fill , a computer program, has just won one of the most prestigious crossword competitions in the US.

title: Sarah Halimi: How killer on drugs escaped French trial for anti-Semitic murder
description: The decision not to prosecute a Jewish woman's killer because of his drug use sparks a legal row in France.

title: Hospital Covid team plant trees to fight climate change
description: Staff from a Cardiff intensive care unit are offsetting the environmental impact of treating patients.

title: Brazil: Vaccinating the Amazon against Covid
description: The BBC follows healthcare workers in Brazil's Amazon region delivering vaccines to one of the most isolated parts of a vast country.

title: My Money: 'It feels like a luxury to shop for non-essential items'
description: Social care worker Sarah takes us through her weekly spending as England's national lockdown lifts.

title: 'More and more people don't want a traditional burial'
description: With cremations on the rise, firms now offer such things as turning your ashes into artificial reef formations or human compost.

title: MOTD analysis: 'Work-rate & lethal finishing' - Bale's perfect performance against Sheff Utd
description: Match of the Day pundits Alan Shearer and Jermaine Jenas praise Gareth Bale after his hat-trick against Sheffield United and say the Welsh forward should have played more often this season.

title: India Covid: Delhi hospitals plead for oxygen as more patients die
description: Desperate messages continued on Sunday night as Delhi's oxygen crisis shows no signs of abating.

title: Shearer and Jenas on Man Utd fans' protest
description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Alan Shearer and Jermaine Jenas discuss the protests against the Glazer family which led to the postponement of Manchester United's game against Liverpool.

title: A £455m debt and the ESL: Man Utd protests explained
description: Protests at Manchester United's Old Trafford ground came just weeks after European Super League plans were thwarted - but emotions have been simmering for 16 years.

title: Kyrgyzstan-Tajikistan: Images of destruction after border clashes
description: At least 46 people were killed while homes, schools and checkpoints were destroyed in the dispute.

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: Iran treatment 'amounts to torture', says Dominic Raab
description: The foreign secretary says Tehran's sentencing of the UK-Iranian national is "abusive" and unlawful.

title: Social media abuse has changed me - Karen Carney
description: Karen Carney says the online abuse she has suffered has "changed" her and that social media companies "don't understand" the impact it has.

title: Trespass arrests at Prince Andrew's Windsor home
description: A 29-year-old woman and a 31-year-old man are detained in the Royal Lodge grounds, police say.

title: Israel crush: Day of mourning after dozens killed at Jewish festival
description: The country grieves after a crush at a Jewish festival killed 45 men and boys and injured many others.

title: Raab dismisses 'gossip' as he defends Johnson over flat revamp costs
description: Meanwhile, the Scottish Conservative leader says PM should resign if he is found to have broken rules.

title: India coronavirus: New record deaths as virus engulfs India
description: India records another dire milestone, but the government continues to resist a full lockdown.

title: Covid: Quarantine for Covid contacts could be scrapped
description: A trial of daily testing is planned, as the foreign secretary says the UK is in a "good position".

title: Julia James murder: PCSO's uncle in plea to find killer
description: Julia James' uncle makes a public plea, as it emerges the National Crime Agency is helping.

title: SpaceX ISS mission: Night-time splashdown for four astronauts
description: Four astronauts splash down off the coast of Florida after a six-month mission to the International Space Station.

title: Don't trust caller ID on phones, says Ofcom
description: The service should not be used as a means of verifying identity in the battle against fraud, Ofcom says.

title: Dirty Vegan star nears end of cross-Atlantic row
description: Celebrity chef Matt Pritchard injures his back rowing the Atlantic for charity in a four-man crew.

title: The Papers: 'Three steps to normal life'
description: Sunday papers cover the easing of England's lockdown, and a possible vaccine plan for schoolchildren.

title: Surgery in the womb: 'I've done the best for her'
description: Helena Purcell travelled to Belgium for an NHS-funded procedure on her unborn baby's spina bifida.

title: Line of Duty: Five unanswered questions for the series six finale
description: Ahead of the series six finale, these key questions definately need more than "no comment".
